examples: a square deal

results.definition: a formal and conservative person with old-fashioned views

examples: hit the ball squarely
the bat met the ball squarely
planted his great bulk square before his enemy

results.definition: the product of two equal terms
examples: gravity is inversely proportional to the square of the distance
four square meals a day
a square contradiction

results.definition: (geometry) a plane rectangle with four equal sides and four right angles; a four-sided regular polygon
examples: you can compute the area of a square if you know the length of its sides
square the wood with a file
looked him squarely in the eye
ran square into me

results.definition: someone who doesn't understand what is going on

examples: a squarely cut piece of paper
folded the sheet of paper square

results.definition: an open area at the meeting of two or more streets
a hand tool consisting of two straight arms at right angles; used to construct or test right angles
examples: the carpenter who built this room must have lost his square

results.definition: any artifact having a shape similar to a plane geometric figure with four equal sides and four right angles
examples: a checkerboard has 64 squares
one idea squares with another

results.definition: cause to match, as of ideas or acts
having four equal sides and four right angles or forming a right angle
examples: a square peg in a round hole
a square corner
my account with you is now all square

results.definition: pay someone and settle a debt
examples: I squared with him

results.definition: position so as to be square
examples: He squared his shoulders

results.definition: something approximating the shape of a square
